1.text: My son, keep my words, and lay up my commandments with you.

2.text: Keep my commandments, and live; and my law as the apple of your eye.

3.text: Bind them on your fingers, write them on the table of your heart.

4.text: Say to wisdom, You are my sister; and call understanding your kinswoman:

5.text: That they may keep you from the strange woman, from the stranger which flatters with her words.

6.text: For at the window of my house I looked through my casement,

7.text: And beheld among the simple ones, I discerned among the youths, a young man void of understanding,

8.text: Passing through the street near her corner; and he went the way to her house,

9.text: In the twilight, in the evening, in the black and dark night:

10.text: And, behold, there met him a woman with the attire of an harlot, and subtle of heart.

11.text: (She is loud and stubborn; her feet abide not in her house:

12.text: Now is she without, now in the streets, and lies in wait at every corner.)

13.text: So she caught him, and kissed him, and with an impudent face said to him,

14.text: I have peace offerings with me; this day have I paid my vows.

15.text: Therefore came I forth to meet you, diligently to seek your face, and I have found you.

16.text: I have decked my bed with coverings of tapestry, with carved works, with fine linen of Egypt.

17.text: I have perfumed my bed with myrrh, aloes, and cinnamon.

18.text: Come, let us take our fill of love until the morning: let us solace ourselves with loves.

19.text: For the manager is not at home, he is gone a long journey:

20.text: He has taken a bag of money with him, and will come home at the day appointed.

21.text: With her much fair speech she caused him to yield, with the flattering of her lips she forced him.

22.text: He goes after her straightway, as an ox goes to the slaughter, or as a fool to the correction of the stocks;

23.text: Till a dart strike through his liver; as a bird hastens to the snare, and knows not that it is for his life.

24.text: Listen to me now therefore, O you children, and attend to the words of my mouth.

25.text: Let not your heart decline to her ways, go not astray in her paths.

26.text: For she has cast down many wounded: yes, many strong men have been slain by her.

27.text: Her house is the way to hell, going down to the chambers of death.
